description: The Amazon EKS Auth API and the AssumeRoleForPodIdentity action are only used by the EKS Pod Identity Agent. We recommend that applications use the Amazon Web Services SDKs to connect to Amazon Web Services services; if credentials from an EKS Pod Identity association are available in the pod, the latest versions of the SDKs use them automatically.

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the cluster for the request.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The token of the Kubernetes service account for the pod.

nested_items.name: namespace
nested_items.description: The name of the Kubernetes namespace inside the cluster to create the association in. The service account and the pods that use the service account must be in this namespace.

nested_items.name: serviceAccount
nested_items.description: The name of the Kubernetes service account inside the cluster to associate the IAM credentials with.

nested_items.name: audience
nested_items.description: The identity that is allowed to use the credentials. This value is always pods.eks.amazonaws.com.

nested_items.name: podIdentityAssociation
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and ID of the EKS Pod Identity association.

nested_items.name: associationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the EKS Pod Identity association.

nested_items.name: assumedRoleUser
nested_items.description: An object with the permanent IAM role identity and the temporary session name.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that the temporary credentials authenticate to.

nested_items.name: assumeRoleId
nested_items.description: The session name of the temporary session requested to STS. The value is a unique identifier that contains the role ID, a colon ( :), and the role session name of the role that is being assumed. The role ID is generated by IAM when the role is created. The role session name part of the value follows this format: eks-clustername-podname-random UUID.

nested_items.name: credentials
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Signature Version 4 type of temporary credentials.

nested_items.name: sessionToken
nested_items.description: The token that applications inside the pods must pass to any service API to use the temporary credentials.

nested_items.name: secretAccessKey
nested_items.description: The secret access key that applications inside the pods use to sign requests.

nested_items.name: accessKeyId
nested_items.description: The access key ID that identifies the temporary security credentials.

nested_items.name: expiration
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in seconds when the current credentials expire.
